thread.section_title: Timhotel Nation - UPDATED 2017 Hotel Reviews & Price Comparison (Paris, France) - TripAdvisor
thread.title: Report from room 515
thread.title_full: Report from room 515 - Review of Timhotel Nation, Paris, France - TripAdvisor

author: EvaMi590
title: Report from room 515
text:
I have visited Paris around 20 times and stayed at a lot of different hotels. Generally rooms are small and Timhotel's rooms (at least room 515) is actually a little bit larger than many other Parisian hotelrooms. The room was very clean and nice. Bathroom very small (no surprise ...) but functional. Hair dryer included. One of the two lights in the mirror was out of order and need to be changed though.
Hot water kettle, tea and coffee facilities in room. Breakfast buffet has something for everybody - even pancakes, and is served in a nice room or in the small backyard garden.
I suspect that, at least the room we had, will be very hot during summer (there's a fan in the room) as the sun shines on the windows from morning to sunset. We were there i March, so we didn't have a problem with that at all. All Timhotel rooms are not in the main buildning and I have no idea about the standard in the other rooms, but maybe, just maybe ... it's an explanation to why people's reviews of the hotel is quite varying?
Location is superduper. All kinds of stores, restaurants, bars in vincinity. The 3 metrostations - all nearby, give access to all of Paris.
We can definitely book this hotel in future as we have nothing to complain about and our stay was really enjoyable.
